body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}


In this conversation, the agent's name is Ryan James and the customer's name is Carol Scott.  The conversation is about Phat Hogs (a Motorcycle Dealership ) and is a conversation about typical situation.The customer is feeling {emotion}.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello! My name is Ryan James, and I'm with Phat Hogs, your friendly neighborhood motorcycle dealership.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: It's a pleasure to meet you, Carol! How can I assist you today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I'm looking to get some information about purchasing a new motorcycle.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Of course! Could you please provide me with your phone number so I can give you a call if necessary?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Sure, it's two zero one, five five five, three four eight seven.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you! And may I also have your email address to send you some information?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Great! Now, what specific features are you looking for in a motorcycle?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I want something lightweight and good for city commuting.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: I have just the bike in mind that would suit your needs perfectly. Thank you for your time, Carol! I’ll follow up with all the details soon.
